decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize the interaction between various cards such as Blade of the Bloodchief, Vexing Bauble, and Kozilek's Command to establish a powerful combo with Basking Broodscale and Emrakul, the Promised End. By generating mana with cards like Springleaf Drum and Ancient Stirrings, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Devourer of Destiny. The inclusion of lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Eldrazi Temple enhances the deck's ability to cast its powerful spells efficiently.

The main idea behind this deck is to use the ramp and mana acceleration provided by Birthing Ritual to quickly cast powerful creatures and disrupt the opponent using counter spells and bounce effects. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent by constantly deploying threats while also having answers to their plays. It utilizes a mix of creatures with evasion and disruptive abilities to control the board and maintain tempo. Additionally, the deck includes some land destruction elements to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Devourer of Destiny. The key concept of this deck is to create a combo with Malevolent Rumble, Basking Broodscale, and Glaring Fleshraker to overwhelm the opponent with creature removal and massive damage. Supporting cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain help to boost the creatures' power and abilities, while Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern provide disruption and control against opponent strategies.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, and removal spells. It aims to control the battlefield, maintain card advantage, and gradually grind out the opponent's resources. The deck utilizes a mix of powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, along with card draw and utility spells to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. By carefully managing resources and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to establish dominance and secure victory through efficient control tactics.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through ramping up mana with Eldrazi creatures and using powerful spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Icetill Explorer and Utopia Sprawl, the deck can quickly ramp up to summon big Eldrazi threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. With spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble, the deck can control the board and hinder the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck focuses on ramping up quickly, controlling the game, and finishing off with powerful Eldrazi creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. The goal is to set up a combo that allows you to put these creatures into play instantly. Cards like Faithful Mending and No More Lies help dig for combo pieces while cards like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize provide disruption against the opponent. The mana base is designed to support multiple colors and provide flexibility for casting spells. The key strategy is to win the game quickly through a powerful reanimation combo.

This Jeskai Ascendancy combo deck focuses on using Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to cycle through artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and draw cards. Cori-Steel Cutter helps to dig for combo pieces, while Urza's Saga can tutor for key artifacts. Portable Hole and Metallic Rebuke provide disruption, while Repeal can bounce problematic permanents. The deck aims to assemble Jeskai Ascendancy alongside a significant number of noncreature spells to generate a lethal amount of mana and card draw to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. Ephemerate and Solitude provide both removal and protection for your creatures, allowing you to maintain board presence. Quantum Riddler and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer additional threats that can quickly close out the game. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells and abilities.

The deck focuses on ramping quickly and efficiently into Primeval Titans using Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and take extra turns with cards like Scapeshift and Aftermath Analyst to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful land combos like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Green Sun's Zenith to search for specific answers, as well as utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to generate overwhelming advantage and win the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures that disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also taxing their resources. By utilizing cards like Solitude and Witch Enchanter, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With a strong mana base and a blend of aggressive and disruptive creatures, the deck can apply pressure early on and maintain control throughout the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Ephemerate allows for powerful creature recursion and tempo plays to further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through ramping up mana with Eldrazi creatures and spells. Utilizing cards like Icetill Explorer and Sowing Mycospawn to ramp up quickly, the deck aims to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Ugin's Labyrinth provides additional control. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive Eldrazi threats and maintain control of the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand onto the battlefield quickly. The deck also features disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog provide additional utility and card advantage, while Faithful Mending and Consign to Memory help with card selection and graveyard recursion. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. The deck also includes cards that provide card advantage and flexibility such as Ephemerate and Consign to Memory. The key strategy is to quickly apply pressure with efficient creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with removal and disruptive spells, aiming to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on using a combination of cards to create a powerful win condition without relying on traditional lands. By utilizing cards like Lotus Bloom and Waterlogged Teachings, along with combo pieces like Goblin Charbelcher and Thundertrap Trainer, the deck aims to disrupt opponent's strategies while building towards a game-winning combo finish. With counterspells like Force of Negation and Flare of Denial, as well as control elements like Sink into Stupor and Disrupting Shoal, the deck aims to control the game until it can assemble its key combo pieces for victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient burn spells. It focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly deal damage, while utilizing spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and finish off the opponent. The deck also includes card draw spells like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble to maintain momentum. Overall, the strategy revolves around a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle to outpace and outdamage the opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 matchup.

The deck focuses on countering and controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalker abilities. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler while maintaining board control with cards like Supreme Verdict and Solitude. The deck also utilizes cards like Isochron Scepter and Stern Scolding for additional control options. Additionally, Kaheera, the Orphanguard serves as a companion that provides additional synergy with the deck's creature spells.
